Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Disallow aria-expanded for collapsible elements without an allowed role" (#9464) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9415

Added a fix to the JavaScript that controls collapsible elements to not add the `aria-expanded` attribute for elements that do not have an [allowed role](https://w3c.github.io/aria/#aria-expanded).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Hide metadata for any package that is both unlisted and locked" (#9466) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Sometimes on NuGet.org, we want to hide the freeform content of a package so it's no longer rendered on the package details package. Examples of this would be packages that have project URLs linking to domains that have lapsed in their registration and are now spam. Another example is a package that contains somewhat ambiguous, potentially offensive language that does not meet the threshold of a deletion (takedown).

Currently, we have this behavior for `package is unlisted AND package is locked AND all owners are locked`. We should just remove the `all owners are locked` criteria:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/0931f8b8176fc59d6bf0d47dee2baf686db3bea4/src/NuGetGallery/ViewModels/DisplayPackageViewModel.cs#L166

### The Elevator Pitch

This will give the NuGet.org admin team more ability to hide unsafe, offensive, or spammy content that otherwise does not necessitate a deletion.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[A11y] Make screen readers start with packages list on Search Page." (#9465) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes

* Gives focus to `results-column` element to tell screen readers were to start if the `Apply` button or the `Search` button were clicked.
* uses `localStorage` to track if those buttons were clicked before the page refresh.

Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9422

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Add appropriate heading tags to elements" (#9417) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Url: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1743931

Environment Details:
App name: NuGet Service
#URL: [https://www.nuget.org](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fwww.nuget.org%2f&data=05%7c01%7cv-nitipi%40microsoft.com%7c9a84307e7aa744a4b24208dafa5ca2fe%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c638097573052590837%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c3000%7c%7c%7c&sdata=C8Eab3i6ixAmqsOjG4AxNT36z9WZQiXPbjDDkMcS5ME%3D&reserved=0)

OS and Browser Details:
Edition Windows 11 Enterprise
OS build 22621.1105.
Chrome version:  109.0.5414.120 (Official Build) (64-bit)

Repro Steps:
Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter and Unselect Push Checkbox
Run AI4W and check the heading tags are provided or not
Check whether heading level tag is provided to the text "Select Scopes and Select Packages" or not.

NOTE: Similar issue is observed for below screen also.

Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
Navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
Navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
Select “API Keys” from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
Navigate to "Create" button and hit enter.
Enter Values in "Key Name" and "Glob Pattern" field and hit enter on Create button.
Navigate to "Manage" control and hit enter on "Edit" control.
Observe that No heading tag is provided to the text "Select Package".

Actual Result:
No heading tag is provided to the text "Select Scopes and Select Packages"

Expected Result:
H3 Heading level should be assigned to text "Select Scopes and Select Packages"

Notes:
This SHOULD be as simple as changing the element to a H3 and applying the relevant styles.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][TFM] Tooltip icon present beside Frameworks label is defined as both 'frameworks filter information' link and tooltip info button." (#9414) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Url: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1745398

Environment Details:
Application Name: Filtering by Target Frameworks
#URL: [NuGet Gallery | Packages (nugettest.org)](https://dev.nugettest.org/packages?q=)
Windows Version: Win11
OS Version: 22621.1105
Chromium Edge Version: Version 109.0.1518.78 (Official build) (64-bit)

Repro Steps: 
Hit the URL: [NuGet Gallery | Packages (nugettest.org)](https://dev.nugettest.org/packages?q=)
Tab to Frameworks section.
Tab to the tooltip icon present beside Frameworks label.
Press Enter and observe that tooltip info icon is behaving as a Link.
Again Tab to the same tooltip icon present beside Frameworks label .
Press Tab again.
Observe that now tooltip information appears on the same icon.

Actual Result:
Tooltip icon present beside Frameworks label is defined as both 'frameworks filter information' link and tooltip info button.

Expected Result:
Tooltip icon present beside Frameworks label should be defined only as Tooltip info button and 'frameworks filter information' link should be separated from that control.

Notes:
The observed keyboard interaction is a bit confusing. The cleanest thing to do there is likely going to be to separate the hover tooltip information and the link to additional information.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y bug] Package Manager tab on Package details reads as both selected and expanded" (#9460) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes

* Removed `aria-expanded` from DisplayPackage for element that should only have `aria-selected`.
* Added comment stating that `data-toggle="tab"` adds `aria-expanded` every time it's selected/active. So, it needed to be removed when the script is loaded and after the `shown.bs.tab` event.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9418

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Nuget.Build.Taskss caches CredentialProvider device flow timeout." (#12540) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

Nuget 6.5.0.149 (does not seems to be fixed in recent code yet)

### Worked before?

unknown

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

We are working on MSBuild server which is concept of long running process which will execute consequent builds so it can effectively reuse memory caches between builds.  People were reporting intermittent inability to use interactive restore.

### Analysis
Root cause: Task caches result of timeouted CredentialProvider device flow. Consequent runs do not call CredentialProvider and use cached failure value.

Cache is rooted by: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3a0c9a47e24642bb4a4465dec7b4d1c379367855/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/HttpSource/HttpHandlerResourceV3.cs#L40

Result is "wrongly" identified as cacheable at line nr 125 bellow:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3a0c9a47e24642bb4a4465dec7b4d1c379367855/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Credentials/CredentialService.cs#L106-L129

There also seems to to be related bug in CredetionProvider which causes null exception as can be seen in log bellow.
https://github.com/microsoft/artifacts-credprovider/blob/e19f61d6c0697a73fb6b08cd3c9c687f9aa97d36/CredentialProvider.Microsoft/CredentialProviders/Vsts/AdalTokenProvider.cs#L46-L59
Constructor on line 59 fails on null exception when it timeouted because it will pass in null as argument.

### Repro steps
It is hard to repro with existing MSBuild as it has some workarounds around this bug.
I do not believe repro is necessary, log and analysis seem to enough to understand root cause of this bug.
However if I would need to repro it I would:

- prepare project which needs interactive restore
- create console app and link it with msbuild.dll
- in that console app hardcore it to build give project twice
- let first project build timeout on sing in requests
- observe second build to fail without sign in prompt

If repro is really needed please ping me and I can help with building it or testing it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Get push API key from environment variable" (#12539) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

When someone wants to push a package, particularly in a CI or deployment script, they don't want secrets like API keys to be used on the command line or output to logs. At the time of writing this feature request, the dotnet CLI doesn't have an equivalent of `setapikey`, but even if it did, it would require the API key to be passed on the command line. Additionally, API keys currently can only be encrypted, and dur to NuGet using .NET's ProtectedData API, which is Windows only, it also means that this doesn't work on Linux or Mac.

While we have issues for all the above limitations, I believe the need for most of those other work items will be significantly reduced if `push` itself could read the API key from an environment variable. Since API key is only used for push, not restore or other actions, there often isn't a benefit (at least in a CI script) to store the apikey in a nuget.config file. So, we can eliminate one extra step from customer's scripts if push can read the environment variable directly.

Proposal:  Add a `--use--environment-variable` argument to `dotnet nuget push`, which when used will treat the values provided to `--api-key` and `--symbol-api-key` as envionrment variable names, rather than as the secret values.

Therefore, an example usage would be:
```text
dotnet nuget push *.nupkg --use-environment-variable --api-key NUGET_ORG_API_KEY
```


### Additional Context and Details

Relevant other issues:
* https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/1851
* https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7145
* https://github.com/NuGet/Home/pull/12354

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet 6.5.0 not marked as "ReleaseAndBlessed" yet" (#12507) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Hi! [Homebrew](https://github.com/Homebrew/brew) maintainer here.

We noticed that NuGet 6.5.0 was released on 2023-02-21, but after more than one month, it is still marked as "Released" in https://dist.nuget.org/tools.json (rather than "ReleasedAndBlessed"), and thus "not yet recommended for wide-spread consumption" according to https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/tools-json#response. However, I also discovered that NuGet 6.5.0 is [already included in VS 2022](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/announcing-nuget-6-5-the-sweetest-way-to-manage-your-packages/), so I think the status shown in https://dist.nuget.org/tools.json might be outdated. Therefore, I'm filing this issue to confirm the status of the 6.5.0 release. If it's ready for distribution, we'll go ahead and ship the release. Thanks!


### Additional Context and Details

See https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/124524.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org migration towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure" (#60) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In the coming weeks, nuget.org will be migrating towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure that will improve the experience of our users. This change allows our team flexibility to switch to a back-up provider in the case that one CDN is down, which will broaden coverage for our users.

Some changes are coming for older TLS cipher suites, which may result in connectivity issues. From our data we believe this will affect only a small percentage of requests. We will be monitoring all feedback channels during the migration to assess impact and adjust our roll-out timeline as needed.

Below, we provide resources to determine whether you will be affected by this change. This utilizes the [.NET CLI](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/) to install a package from our pre-production (INT) environment which tests connectivity:


```
mkdir cdn-test
cd cdn-test
dotnet new classlib
dotnet add package BaseTestPackage.NetStandard --source https://apiint.nugettest.org/v3/index.json
```

If you are experiencing connectivity issues while connecting to nuget.org or restoring packages from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json, such as:

"The SSL connection could not be established"

Please ensure that TLS 1.2 and any of the following cipher suites have been enabled on your machine:

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

If you have any questions, do reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: NuGet/Home#11058
